answers.answer: It does sound like your daughter could have MD, but there are more things to rule out as well.There are many diseases/ailments that can cause these problems.Without a muscle biopsy and further testing, you won't get any definitive answers.I'm curious as to what the neurologist will have to say, and whether they will do more testing.At this stage, she should be walking up/down stairs just fine.I know some children are a bit slower, but if they feel it's developmental, why aren't they sending her for therapy?My two middle sons both had issues. The older of the two is now 22 and he's been diagnosed with back problems ( curved spine ) which they claim is responsible for his lack of coordination. They told him to go home and play video games...seriously! Now he's lazy, overweight, and has diabetes.All four of my sons are being watched and tested annually for MD, as it runs in our family.

I have md I'm 29 and expecting!My mum found I was late developing I was shuffling not crawling it too 3 years to discover I had mdI'm the youngest of 4 my sisters and brother are fine, strange how it can happen, I'm still mobile, my parents kept me independant as possible, it worked!If u have any questions I'm happy to help x

question: Hello, my daughter is 4 years old.  When she was about 3 years old, we started noticing that she had trouble standing up, running, and especially walking up stairs.  Her primary doctor said it could be developmental issues, but to wait a bit and see if it improves.  She had her hips x-rayed at that time and everything was normal.  Now at 4 years old, she still struggles with standing up without using her hands and going up steps.  We took her to a pediatric orthopedist and everything was normal.  Next, we are taking her to a neurologist.Based on the information I have been reading on MD, she seems to have some form of it.  Any help is appreciated.
title: Early signs of MD?
